intro: Astragalus atraphaxifolius, commonly known as the Persian milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Iran, Afghanistan, and Tajikistan. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky slopes and in well-drained soils. Astragalus atraphaxifolius is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
